title: Weezer Cover Metallica, Go Heavy on the â€œBlue Albumâ€ at Coachella
description: Rivers Cuomo and company played "Enter Sandman" as part of their 12-song set. Weezer Cover Metallica, Go Heavy on the â€œBlue Albumâ€ at Coachella Spencer Kaufman
author: Spencer Kaufman
excerpt: Weezer played a 12-song set of favorites and a Metallica cover at Coachella just days after a headline-making incident involving bassist Scott Shriner's wife.
text: Weezer didnâ€™t let a recent headline-making incident stop them from delivering a stellar performance at the Coachella festival on Saturday (April 12th). The Los Angeles band, who were a last-minute addition to the fest, played a 12-song set of fan favorites and a cover of a Metallica classic. It was only a few days ago when bassist Scott Shrinerâ€™s wife, Jillian Lauren, was shot by police and subsequently arrested for attempted murder in a bizarre case that involved a manhunt for three individuals involved in a high speed chase that ended up with one of the suspects on the coupleâ€™s property. Get Weezer Tickets Here Despite the high-profile incident, Shriner and Weezer forged ahead with their Coachella appearance on the Mojave stage, and fans were treated to a set that spotlighted the bandâ€™s multiplatinum self-titled debut, also known as â€œThe Blue Album.â€ In fact, Weezer played five songs from the 1994 LP, including the set-opener â€œMy Name Is Jonas,â€ along with â€œUndone â€“ The Sweater Song,â€ â€œSurf Wax America,â€ â€œSay It Ainâ€™t So,â€ and the set-closer, â€œBuddy Holly.â€ The band had a little fun during the dialogue intro of â€œUndone â€“ The Sweater Song,â€ with guitarist Brian Bell making it all about Coachella, including mention of an after-party in Green Dayâ€™s dressing room. They also switched up the lyrics to â€œBeverly Hills,â€ shouting, â€œLiving in Coachella, California.â€ Itâ€™s no secret that frontman Rivers Cuomo was a metalhead growing up, and he showed his love for Metallica when Weezer covered â€œEnter Sandmanâ€ 10 songs into the set, eliciting a massive sing-along from the crowd. Cuomo played a blistering solo during the Metallica cover, even working in a little taste of â€œBuddy Holly.â€ Weezer will play a handful of US festivals in May, followed by a few more in the fall (with tickets available here). Theyâ€™ll also hit the UK and Europe for a number of festivals and headlining shows beginning in June. html:
Weezer didnâ€™t let a recent headline-making incident stop them from delivering a stellar performance at the Coachella festival on Saturday (April 12th). The Los Angeles band, who were a last-minute addition to the fest, played a 12-song set of fan favorites and a cover of a Metallica classic.

It was only a few days ago when bassist Scott Shrinerâ€™s wife, Jillian Lauren, was shot by police and subsequently arrested for attempted murder in a bizarre case that involved a manhunt for three individuals involved in a high speed chase that ended up with one of the suspects on the coupleâ€™s property.

Get Weezer Tickets Here

Despite the high-profile incident, Shriner and Weezer forged ahead with their Coachella appearance on the Mojave stage, and fans were treated to a set that spotlighted the bandâ€™s multiplatinum self-titled debut, also known as â€œThe Blue Album.â€ In fact, Weezer played five songs from the 1994 LP, including the set-opener â€œMy Name Is Jonas,â€ along with â€œUndone â€“ The Sweater Song,â€ â€œSurf Wax America,â€ â€œSay It Ainâ€™t So,â€ and the set-closer, â€œBuddy Holly.â€

The band had a little fun during the dialogue intro of â€œUndone â€“ The Sweater Song,â€ with guitarist Brian Bell making it all about Coachella, including mention of an after-party in Green Dayâ€™s dressing room. They also switched up the lyrics to â€œBeverly Hills,â€ shouting, â€œLiving in Coachella, California.â€

Itâ€™s no secret that frontman Rivers Cuomo was a metalhead growing up, and he showed his love for Metallica when Weezer covered â€œEnter Sandmanâ€ 10 songs into the set, eliciting a massive sing-along from the crowd. Cuomo played a blistering solo during the Metallica cover, even working in a little taste of â€œBuddy Holly.â€

Weezer will play a handful of US festivals in May, followed by a few more in the fall (with tickets available here). Theyâ€™ll also hit the UK and Europe for a number of festivals and headlining shows beginning in June.
